basically I've only baked the bottom

color
I've gone for green and yellow so let's

matching colored fondant now I will
mention it's always better to color the

and to get this tan color on my cupcake
base I used 80% white chocolate and 10

just to give us that really nice latte
color and then I colored my fondant once
you've got a nice even long thin sausage
rolled out of your fondant take your
water and your paintbrush and just paint

you just want to rest it on the top rest
it gently first before you start pushing

about the right length use your fingers
and just go around neaten it up and sort
of push it down into those little report
groups this actually extends the height
of your cupcake case a little bit but it
also provides more of a basket sort of
an effect and it enables you to hold the

gives you a bit more room for it make
sure that it's really nice and smooth
nice and flush sprinkle down a little

green and we're also going to do a

out and I'm going to use rectangles

because these are going to make sort of
like our little bunting flags or our

of our hot-air balloon basket and you
want them to kind of look like they're
flowing in the breeze so thinner is
better once you've rolled out a long

pieces roughly the same sort of width
the length it doesn't really matter but
roughly the same width then we're going

so I find the knife best for this and I

this is another reason why we applied
that fondant sausage
it's going to stick a little bit better

to stick directly to the chocolate of
that cupcake case you want to put your

ends and tilt them in different

your little bunting flags are in place
and with your last one you may just need

that it fits in your little remaining

those little bunting flags on it's time
to apply a ganache now with this ganache
ganache goes through a couple of
different stages when you first make it
it's really hot and it's really runny
you don't want this ganache to be hot or
even warm because it's going to be
touching that chocolate if you leave it
to set for a couple of hours it goes
really really firm and you don't want it
too firm so I recommend making it about
an hour or so before you want to use it
and just leaving it on the bench scoop
about a cup or so of that ganache into
the top of your giant cupcake and then
just use the back of your spoon just to
really even it out it's get a depend on
how much space you've left between the
cupcake and at the top of your little
fondant sausage as to exactly how much
can gnash you're going to need for the
top of this giant cupcake I will also
mention that I use the ganache to layer
my cupcake rather than a buttercream so
I made a full batch of the ganache and
I've used right throughout the cake now
we want to attach our cake to a little
cake board so just take a bit of that
melted white chocolate and your

going to be to securely glue our basket
to the board stick the basket straight
on the board and while the chocolates
still wet you've got a couple of seconds

make sure that it's really nice and
centered in those clouds take your blown

going to be a bit harder than it looks
and it can be kind of tricky so
basically what you want to do is you
want to feed it through the first a

then have the little tail hanging out
the third before you stick it on that
little cup now check the height of your

touch tall so when I stuck it in my

cake I'm actually going to try
about three inches or so of the bass
that balloon stick so that my balloon is
much closer to my cake which makes it
look more realistic like a hot-air
